title: Where to purchase "Rasp"
content: I need to use the font Rasp to match previous pieces for a restaurant. I can't find it anywhere. Does anyone know where I might be able to buy this font? Thank you!
author: Jodi Genest

comments.content:
Hmmm, Rasp?  
Are you sure?  
What does it look like?

EDIT: [Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624002548/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=59735) is a thread which looks interesting.

Rasp is a WSI font, see here: [http://bowfinprintworks.com/ListPages/ScriptListQR.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624002548/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ListPages/ScriptListQR.html "http://bowfinprintworks.com/ListPages/ScriptListQR.html")  
That said:www.weatherlysystems.com seems to be not int he business of selling fonts any longer.
Thanks. I did find the bowfinprintworks site, but didn't know what Wsi was. And yes, it does seem that weatherlysystems.com is gone. Still looking...

[http://www.creativeinvitations.net/fonts.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624002548/http:/www.creativeinvitations.net/fonts.htm "http://www.creativeinvitations.net/fonts.htm")  
Here is a site of someone who makes invitations who uses the font Rasp. You'll be able to see the font if you scroll down to R. They don't sell fonts, however.

So. And why don't you take the [Chicken Scratch](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624002548/http:/www.astigmatic.com/freeware.html) instead, as Metro2005 suggested in my link above? Looks like the same base â€¦

Rainer is giving you the right info - perhaps this image will explain why WSI fonts are looked at with questions as to originality. Go with ChickenScratch ( a free font)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624002548im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ChickenRasp_6367.jpg)
Thanks for the effort you made, Bob

Thank you! I've now got Chicken Scratch.

I greatly appreciate your help.
